title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
9-8-7-6 points: Stronger

AN ESSAY IN THIS CATEGORY WILL ILLUSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES WITH VARYING DEGREES OF EFFECTIVENESS:

  1. Has a clear, well-developed thesis.

  2. Is well organized.

  3. Makes apt use of most documents, perhaps implicitly ("most" means more than half of the documents).

  4. Analyzes more than describes; for example, discusses sources' reliability and point of view, groups documents appropriately, and refers to historical context.

  5. May contain minor errors; even a "9" need not be flawless.

Notes:

  • Instructions to the students call for "specific examples to support your answer." Specific examples need not be specific names.

  • 9s and 8s will address, in comparison and contrast, each of the following:

    1. Renaissance rulers as patrons;

    2. the artists or arts (genres) these rulers patronized;

    3. dictators of the 1930's as patrons; and

    4. the artists or arts (genres) these dictators patronized or suppressed.

  • 7s and 6s must acknowledge all four of the above factors but only address in comparison [perhaps implicitly] and contrast two of the four categories; they must include patronage as an element.

  • Essays in this stronger category clearly see geographical, chronological dichotomy; may cite dictators as patrons (e.g., Hitler/Albert Speer) but probably will contrast with Renaissance rulers by saying 1930's dictators suppressed individual expression. Thesis will probably be: "Renaissance recognized and heralded individual artists' expression while 1930's dictators suppressed similar individuality." Comparison motives: propaganda, glory, fame, prestige, power in both cases, maybe even a "protonationalistic" motive for Renaissance rulers, certainly a nationalistic (folk, militaristic, even bombastic) and perhaps international (USSR) motive for dictators.

5-4 points: Mixed

THESE SCORES SHOULD BE ASSIGNED JUDICIOUSLY.

  1. Contains a thesis, perhaps superficial or simplistic.

  2. Responds to the terms of the question unevenly: task(s), evidence, chronology.

  3. May contain errors, factual and/or interpretive.

Notes:

  • Thesis is probably a simplistic comparative one of "both were the same in their motives" or a contrasting one of "Renaissance rulers were more generous; 1930's dictators were totalitarian, repressive."

  • Is unclear on geography (locating Renaissance rulers, 1930's dictators); chronology (doesn't "locate" Renaissance in time, or locates wrong rulers in the 1930's.)

  • Far too heavily weighted on either Renaissance or 1930's dictators side.

3-2-1-0 points: Weaker

AN ESSAY IN THIS CATEGORY WILL DEMONSTRATE THE FOLLOWING QUALITIES TO VARYING DEGREES. ESSAYS SCORED 0 OR 1 MAY ATTEMPT TO ADDRESS THE QUESTION, BUT FAIL TO DO SO.

  1. Thesis confused, unfocused, or absent, or simply restates question.

  2. Misconstrues the question or omits major task(s).

  3. Supporting information is superficial, irrelevant, or missing.

  4. May contain major errors.

Notes:

  • Doesn't demonstrate an understanding of several of the following: patronage, Renaissance, rulers, dictators, 1930's, arts. Thesis is thus confused.

  • Student doesn't understand comparing and contrasting patrons of the two categories, places, and periods.

— Non-responsive

Response totally off-task, absent, or irrelevant.
